      • handleInit

        javafx.util.Pair<com.google.gson.JsonObject,java.lang.Byte[]> handleInit(com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpExchange exchange)
                                                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Gets the input from http connection and encrypts the data.

        Instructions to make txt to send

        1. Stringify the JSON file to send
        2. Encode the json string by base64
        3. Make random string for AES key
        4. Make string with format {public key(encoded base64)}:{text(encoded base64)}:{signature}
        5. Encrypt the formatted string with AES key
        6. Make RSA key pair
        7. Encrypt the AES key with server public RSA key
        8. Make string with format {encrypted AES key}:{encrypted data}
        Parameters:
        exchange - exchange object for connection
        Returns:
        Pair of json and public key gotten
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when something goes wrong

      • send

        void send(com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpExchange exchange,
          java.lang.String data,
          java.lang.Byte[] key)
   throws java.io.IOException
        Sends the data with encryption from public key

        It signs the data with server private key and encrypts the whole data. Then encodes the string with base64.

        Instructions to get txt from server

        1. Text would be format {encrypted AES key}:{encrypted data}
        2. Decrypt the AES key with client's private RSA key
        3. Decrypt the data with AES key
        4. Data would be format {data (encoded base64)}:{signature}
        5. Verify signature with server's public RSA key
        6. Decode the data with base64
        Parameters:
        exchange - http exchange object
        data - data to send
        key - key to encrypt
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when something goes wrong
